Microssa

Class Hooks

  • java.lang.Object
    • Microssa.Hooks

  • public class Hooks
extends java.lang.Object
    These are customizable hooks to notify another system of the activities of the MatchingEngine. They were intentionally left blank. Examples of use would be to feed a ticker, database, compliance, or middle/back office system.
    See Also:
    MatchingEngine

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Hooks()
      This is a static class.

      Called when an order amendment fails.
      static void CancelOrderHook(Order CanOrder)
      Called when an order has been explicitly canceled in the MatchingEngine.

      Called when an order cancel fails.

      Called when a match happens.

      Called when a new Order reaches the MatchingEngine.

      Called when a new Order is rejected by the MatchingEngine.

      Called when an order is fully filled.
      static void OrderExpireHook(Order ExpOrder)
      Called when an IOC order has available quantity after attempting to execute.

    • Method Detail

      • NewOrderHook

        public static void NewOrderHook(Order NewOrder)
        Called when a new Order reaches the MatchingEngine.
        Parameters:
        NewOrder - The new Order object

      • AmendOrderHook

        public static void AmendOrderHook(Order OldOrder,
                                  Order NewOrder)
        Called when an order has been amended in the MatchingEngine.
        Parameters:
        OldOrder - The Order object before the amendment
        NewOrder - The Order object after the amendment

      • CancelOrderHook

        public static void CancelOrderHook(Order CanOrder)
        Called when an order has been explicitly canceled in the MatchingEngine.
        Parameters:
        CanOrder - The Order object being canceled

      • OrderExpireHook

        public static void OrderExpireHook(Order ExpOrder)
        Called when an IOC order has available quantity after attempting to execute. Unimplemented for GFD orders.
        Parameters:
        ExpOrder - The Order object that is expired

      • OrderCompleteHook

        public static void OrderCompleteHook(Order CompOrder)
        Called when an order is fully filled.
        Parameters:
        CompOrder - The Order object that is completed

      • NewOrderRejectHook

        public static void NewOrderRejectHook(Order NewOrder,
                                      java.lang.String RejectText)
        Called when a new Order is rejected by the MatchingEngine.
        Parameters:
        NewOrder - The new Order object
        RejectText - Reason for the reject

      • AmendOrderRejectHook

        public static void AmendOrderRejectHook(Order OldOrder,
                                        Order NewOrder,
                                        java.lang.String RejectText)
        Called when an order amendment fails.
        Parameters:
        OldOrder - The Order object before the amendment
        NewOrder - The Order object after the amendment
        RejectText - Reason for the reject

      • CancelOrderRejectHook

        public static void CancelOrderRejectHook(Order CanOrder,
                                         java.lang.String RejectText)
        Called when an order cancel fails.
        Parameters:
        CanOrder - The Order object being canceled
        RejectText - Reason for the reject

      • ExecutionHook

        public static void ExecutionHook(Order aOrder,
                                 Order pOrder,
                                 java.lang.Double Price,
                                 java.lang.Double Quantity)
        Called when a match happens.
        Parameters:
        aOrder - The aggressive (or, new/amended) order
        pOrder - The passive (or, one in the book) order
        Price - The execution price. May be different from the either orders' because of price improvement
        Quantity - The Amount of the execution
